website_summaries.verdict: Sharp-looking stainless steel kettle set delivers safe results with simple cleanup afterward.
pros: Heat conduction is excellent with the stainless steel construction, delivering an even cooking result
Available in sizes between 8 and 16 gallons, so you can pick the perfect size for your brewing needs
This pot works equally well for cooking seafood or boiling peanuts

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality with too much dead space
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for a high quality mash tun, this one may fit the bill. I think its more suited for 10 gallon normal gravity beers or 5 gallon high gravity batches. There is approximately 2.5 gallons of dead space which will make it difficult for low or average gravity beers to fully convert. Also you'll need to have a pretty high water to grist ratio to get it to work. you could consider filling up the dead space with marbles or plates or something. Also I recommend putting in a dip tube to ensure you get more efficiency out of the tun.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew L Herrold

customer_reviews.title: Excellent induction ready home mash-master!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product at a great price. Easy assembly with clear instructions (step by step pictures) and tools needed to complete. Appreciate the lighter weight especially when shifting off the cooktop. Works well with our 1800 watt induction heat source.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dont trust the markings for gallons
customer_reviews.text: Great value for money but a couple of misses. I had a little over 11 gallons after my first batch, shouldn't have trusted the markings without testing. I ended up with 9.5 gallons leaving one of my fermentors short. Came with a dent in the bottom, kept it since I'm more worried about function than looks, just wish the gallon Mark's were accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Joel S

customer_reviews.title: Solid kettle, good for home brew, arrived dented.
customer_reviews.text: Solid boil kettle for this price point. Good looking stainless steel. Gallon markings on kettle are a big plus. Instructions are junk though for assembling the thermometer and ball valve/spigot, but no biggie; anyone can probably figure it out. But much like several other customers, both of mine arrived with dents near the bottom (bought two, seperate times). Poor packaging. Otherwise a pretty decent starter home brew pot.
customer_reviews.author: ChesapeakeFan

customer_reviews.title: An all-grain kettle that does the job!
customer_reviews.text: Does the job. The only downside is most times, you have to pull out the false bottom while mashing. I would also double check the temperature with a second device. We've found that the wort can actually vary slightly than what the temperature gauge reads.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: This brew kettle is a solid build. Very easy to put together. Worked very well on brew day. There were no leaks, scorching or overflows. The thermometer made it very easy to keep track of my temperatures. The pourspout worked just as it should with no leaks. I would definitely recommend this kettle to anyone breaking into the all grain brewing method. This kettle is a good starting point and a good price.
customer_reviews.author: BigMikeOf33617

customer_reviews.title: Great brew pot
customer_reviews.text: I've made a couple of batches of beer using this pot. Easy to assemble in my opinion, just need to make sure to tighten connection well to prevent leaking. During my first batch I had a couple of leaks, but a little further tightening and was good to go. Good quality and a much better price then the competition.
customer_reviews.author: BBB

customer_reviews.title: Beware of hot water leaks
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be well built, and held liquid at room temperature, but started leaking at spigot when on stove, so it quickly became a big mess of scalding hot water. Not safe. I was only sent one wrench to tighten spigot, but the picture shows two. Perhaps not receiving the proper assembly tools caused this? If the spigot continues to leak, this is unusable to me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: First impressions
customer_reviews.text: This brew pot, on initial review, looks great. It’s easy to assemble, the thermometer is sturdy, the plumbers tape was a nice touch. The valve is adequate. The handle is thin and could have a rubber coating for better grip but that way to upgrade. The false bottom works well, be careful of the thermostat though. I’ll be brewing in a week so I will add updates that will relate to actual use. Overall, it seems like a quality product. That being said, I have not actually boiled, mashed and cleaned this product. Stay tuned!
customer_reviews.author: John T. Lyon

customer_reviews.title: Great kettle, great price.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice kettle, worked very well for full 5 gallon beer brewing. The price is the best I found anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Rice

customer_reviews.title: "Cadillac" of brew kettles for a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: This is the "Cadillac" of brew kettles for a reasonable price. It was easy to assemble everything together. The kettle is sturdy and all the extras are fantastic. It is super convenient to have the thermometer on the front and the spigot is great to just open and fill my fermenting bucket. The first kettle i received had a large dent towards the bottom. I reached out to the manufacturer and they provided excellent support. I was able to exchange and the replacement i received was in pristine condition. Bottom line, I would recommend this kettle to anyone looking to get more serious about home brewing.
customer_reviews.author: R2JR0H

customer_reviews.title: Great value and durable
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 10 gal version in 2018 and it looks like new after many batches of beer! The false bottom and the tube (Bazooka) screen are great for all grain brewing. The 3 ply bottom provides even heating, and the thermometer and the inscribed galleon markings are accurate. Great value!
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Love it but the thermometer doesn't work correctly
customer_reviews.text: The mash tun is very nice to use. Bazooka screen works great, first mash was a stuck one, had to pull it out of 150+ degree water. The holes don't seem to be small enough. The grain was stuck in it. Something may be wrong with my thermometer, get 20-30 degree differences with one i was using. Pot is easy to clean, the triclad bottom is very nice for even heating.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value! Love it! Perfect to up your game!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve brewed on this kettle a couple of times now and love it. A lot of great features! It helped me graduate from extract brewing to BIAB and all grain. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Hank Coleman

customer_reviews.title: Get what you paid for.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together. No leaks. Only reason I have 4 instead of 5 is because handle weld has caused a blemish in the inside that will like corrode and hide bacteria over time.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Product came dented (loss of a star). Packaging is not sufficient. Product is obviously thinner than the more expensive alternatives, but it still does the job. I gave this as a gift to my son-in-law. I have a smaller version and use it on an induction stove as a mash tun. Great inexpensive way to get into All-grain brewing.
customer_reviews.author: DH

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: It was exactly as described. Only issue was that it had a small dent in the bottom. It did not affect the function or integrity though
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the money
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking pot. Walls are not flimsy. Good solid pot. Triclad bottom. Two things I didn't like: thermometer was not accurate, would get stuck at certain degrees. And valve is stiff.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Graver

customer_reviews.title: Clean ball valve prior to use!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great product make sure you disassemble the ball valve and clean all oils from assembly. We almost ruined a batch of wart but cought it before adding grains. Could actually smell it in the water. Otherwise great product and heavy duty
customer_reviews.author: Andy Fangman

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Kettle works well with no leaks after multiple brew sessions. Only complaint is the adjustable thermometer isn't very accurate. I correct it to read 70 like my electronic thermometer and it'll only read 200 when it's got a rolling boil or I correct it to 212 and it'll read 15 over when trying to cool to move to the fermenter.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Directions aren’t good.  Watch a tutorial.
customer_reviews.text: Directions are not very good. If you buy it, watch tutorial videos online before putting it together. If you don’t do it right (not how it was in the instructions I got) you will have leaks.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Ulett

customer_reviews.title: Problematic Pots
customer_reviews.text: I purchased three for home brewing and one won't seal without using JB Weld silicone, and the other is already rusted inside. Recommend forgoing this garbage and getting a higher quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Good Kettle
customer_reviews.text: I got this for beer making and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good kettle for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful kettle for the money. Can't wait to use it on my brewstand.
customer_reviews.author: mjfjr

customer_reviews.title: Be prepared to receive damaged product
customer_reviews.text: Shipping packaging was horrible, had 3 large dents, all but one I beat out with a rubber hammer. It was on a seam so nothing I could do about it. Still a good product but it is made in china.
customer_reviews.author: Michae

customer_reviews.title: Lid did not fit.
customer_reviews.text: Lid did not fit as it is supposed to, kettle was oblong compared to lid. Have to push down with force for it to settle properly. When it would boil it'd want to pop with pressure. When you'd release pressure it'd rattle very loudly and vibrate.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Orndorff

customer_reviews.title: Good overall
customer_reviews.text: I've brewed 3 batches so far and the pot has worked well for the price. The thermometer needed calibrating and the metal is fairly thin which causes some flex when turning the valve, but no leaks so far.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great mash ton /brew kettle
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for brewing. The thermometer seemed accurate, but I used a digital instant read one for better accuracy when mashing
customer_reviews.author: Kain B

customer_reviews.title: Dented but no Mark's on box
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these. On e was dented and missing the thermometer.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Great pot for brewing
customer_reviews.text: Great pot for brewing. I am on my third batch and find it so much easier than a 3 gallon pot on my stove.
customer_reviews.author: carlos camarillo

customer_reviews.title: The bazooka screen clogs easily and gets in the way if you are using ...
customer_reviews.text: My first actual brew keg. I brewed 2 batches in one day this week. The valve and thermometer are very convenient. I didnt use the false bottom, but it might come in handy eventually. The bazooka screen clogs easily and gets in the way if you are using a wort chiller, but that might be a technique problem on my end. Everything included seems to be very high quality. I would recomend this to other small batch brewers.
customer_reviews.author: Seth D. Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: Great boiling pot for the price. Comparable to $300+ pots from other brands. Shipping was fast and package was intact with no issues. I would recommend this vessel over several others that I have had. Ball valve is 1/2 FNPT.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Overall OK. Poor packaging and instructions.
customer_reviews.text: Overall satisfied with the purchase. It’s pretty and I think it’ll do the job. Relatively inexpensive. Two dislikes: 1. Sides are relatively thin and will deny easily. Mine arrived with two fairly large dents. Not a deal killer, but packaging could be improved. 2. Assembly instructions (just a series of confusing drawings) are horrible. Not at all clear which gaskets go where and how and where to use the provided Teflon tape. I watched a few YouTube videos and they were little better. Got it together and it doesn’t leak, but I have three gaskets left over so not sure I did it right.
customer_reviews.author: P. M. Keene

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Kettle
customer_reviews.text: I needed a large kettle to make Pho broth. I figure If I am going to go through the time consuming process of making homemade pho broth I would do it in large batches. This kettle worked awesome for that purpose. The built in thermometer did require some calibration, but proved to be fairly accurate once calibrated. The false bottom and bazooka screen were extremely helpful when it came time to decant the broth.
customer_reviews.author: Dstone

customer_reviews.title: Arrives dented, metal gives off a strange sand type byproduct on initial boil? China quality??
customer_reviews.text: The sealing washers were prestacked wrong on the fittings. A little common sense is all it takes! No leaks. The packaging did cause a dent the size of Texas due to the valve packaged next to the kettle instead of being placed inside. I popped the dent out pretty easy. I did get some funk when I did my first boil even though I scrubbed the Covid out of the kettle with a stainless steel Brillo pad!
customer_reviews.author: Never Lazy

customer_reviews.title: Great features, little thin
customer_reviews.text: I really like the features of the kettle. The false bottom and the screen are great at keeping grain and hops out. The valve works great and is positioned well height wise. The size is great for single 5 gal batches with plenty of room. My only issue with it is the wall thickness. It is easy to dent and mine came already dented. Other than that, it is a really nice kettle.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: game changer for all grain mash
customer_reviews.text: Have run several mashes with this and grain bags. Have to be careful not to puncture bag with end of thermostat. I have an glass top electirc stove and cheaper pot bottoms do not make full contact. this one does so it heats evenly. hard to decipher the instructions and get it to stop leaking. took me 3 tries. so far so good. Would have given a 5 star except for the above.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome brew kettle!
customer_reviews.text: Love the quality of this monster 16 gallon kettle! Good heavy gauge stainless with an accurate thermometer and a nice drain valve. The lid is heavy gauge and fits tight on the kettle. False bottom is also nice quality. I don't know if I'll ever make a 10 gallon all-grain batch, but this would easily handle it!
customer_reviews.author: MikeCrepit

customer_reviews.title: New Brewhouse
customer_reviews.text: First brewday was last weekend. this thing worked out perfectly. keep in mind there is a fair amount of deadspace with this kettle. i didnt calculate enough so i had to add about a gallon of tap water to my fermenter to top it off, still was only off O.G by .001. installing was pretty easy, just make sure you use a lot of teflon tape. Good luck!
customer_reviews.author: Brett Justus

customer_reviews.title: Not complete
customer_reviews.text: Arrived incomplete, very disappointed. Lacking the hardware for the spigot and no contact information included in the paperwork. I'll hold this for a couple of days to see if I get a response from the manufacturer, but I'm planning to send it back without action.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Clemmons

customer_reviews.title: Where has this been all my life?
customer_reviews.text: I love this pot! It makes brewing days so much easier. It accurate, it makes transfers easier. It makes boils easier. If you are still using a plain pot, get one of these.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Nice brew pot
customer_reviews.text: This brew pot seems to be built very sturdy. I really like the weight of it. Have not used it yet but will be soon. Only gave it 4 stars because when I received it there was only one wrench but 2 are needed to assemble. Attention to detail means alot to me.
customer_reviews.author: Luther Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving it 5 stars because as far as I know they love it. It was given as a gift.

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a very large pot and works well for making large batches. It is constructed well and the quality is great. The false bottom keeps things from burning and the drain makes it easy to use and carry.

customer_reviews.title: 😍😍
customer_reviews.text: Best purchase ever! I love this produce. We use it for everything from broth to beer and it’s absolurelu perfect

customer_reviews.title: Quality and affordable
customer_reviews.text: Quick shipping. Very complete kit. It works very well with my brewing setup.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer
